alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 06 at 11:41AM MDT until further notice by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Montana... Yaak River Near Troy affecting Lincoln County. .Heavy rain may fall on a deep primed snowpack leading to the melt increasing. Flows in rivers may increase quickly and reach critical levels. For the Yaak River...including Near Troy...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Yaak River Near Troy. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Flooding affects low lying areas adjacent to the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:45 AM MDT Saturday, May 06 the stage was 7.5 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Sunday afternoon at 3 PM MDT.
